text.*:
In countries whose armies are organised on a regimental basis, such as the army of the United Kingdom, a regimental museum is a military museum dedicated to the history of a specific army regiment.

Contents

  • 1 List of regimental museums in the UK
    • 1.1 England
    • 1.2 Northern Ireland
    • 1.3 Scotland
    • 1.4 Wales
  • 2 References
  • 3 External links

List of regimental museums in the UK[edit]

In addition to those listed below, many more units (including Yeomanry, Militia and Volunteer regiments) have museums or exhibition spaces, some open only by appointment; for fuller information see the Ogilby Trust website (below).

England[edit]

  • The Army Medical Services Museum is based at Mytchett in Surrey[1]
  • The Museum of Barnstaple and North Devon (for the Royal Devon Yeomanry, Royal 1st Devon Yeomanry and the Royal North Devon Yeomanry) is based in Barnstaple[2]
  • The Bedfordshire and Hertfordshire Regiment gallery is part of Wardown Park Museum in Luton[3]
  • The Border Regiment and its successors have a gallery at Cumbria's Museum of Military Life in Carlisle Castle[4]
  • The Buffs (Royal East Kent Regiment) still has some exhibits at Beany House, although most of the collection was subsumed into the National Army Museum in 2000[5]
  • The Cheshire Military Museum (for The Cheshire Regiment, 3rd Carabiniers, 5th Royal Inniskilling Dragoon Guards and Cheshire Yeomanry) is based at Chester Castle[6]
  • The Devonshire and Dorset regimental collections are displayed in the Keep Military Museum, Dorchester[7]
  • The Duke of Cornwall's Light Infantry regimental collections are displayed at Cornwall's Regimental Museum at Victoria Barracks in Bodmin[8]
  • The Duke of Wellington's Regiment Museum is based at Bankfield House, in Halifax, Yorkshire[9]
  • The DLI Museum in Durham closed in 2016[10]
  • The Essex Regiment Museum is based at Oaklands Park in Chelmsford[11]
  • Firepower – The Royal Artillery Museum was based at Woolwich until it closed in 2016[12]
  • The Fusilier Museum (Lancashire) is based in Bury, Greater Manchester[13]
  • The Fusiliers Museum (London) is based in the Tower of London[14]
  • The Fusiliers Museum of Northumberland is based in Alnwick Castle[15]
  • The Soldiers of Gloucestershire Museum (Gloucestershire Regiment and Royal Gloucestershire Hussars) is based at the historic docks in Gloucester[16]
  • The Green Howards Regimental Museum is based in Richmond, North Yorkshire[17]
  • The Guards Museum is based at Wellington Barracks in London[18]
  • The Gurkha Museum is based at Peninsula Barracks in Winchester[19]
  • The Herefordshire Light Infantry Museum is based in Hereford[20]
  • The Honourable Artillery Company Museum is at Armoury House in London[21]
  • HorsePower: The Museum of the King's Royal Hussars is based at Peninsula Barracks in Winchester[22]
  • The Household Cavalry Museum is based at Horse Guards in London[23]
  • The Inns of Court & City Yeomanry Museum is based at Stone Buildings in London[24]
  • The Kent and Sharpshooters Yeomanry Museum is at Hever Castle, Kent[25]
  • The King's Own Royal Regiment Museum is part of the Lancaster City Museum in Lancaster[26]
  • The King's Own Scottish Borderers Regimental Museum, is based at Berwick Barracks in Berwick-upon-Tweed[27]
  • The Kings Own Yorkshire Light Infantry Museum is based at Doncaster Museum and Art Gallery in Doncaster[28]
  • The King's Regiment Museum collection is displayed in the Museum of Liverpool[29]
  • The Museum of the 14th/20th King's Hussars was in the Museum of Lancashire in Preston until it closed in 2016[30]
  • The Lancashire Infantry Museum (for the Duke of Lancaster's Regiment and the Queen's Lancashire Regiment) is based at Fulwood Barracks in Preston[31]
  • The Museum of the Adjutant General's Corps is based at Peninsula Barracks in Winchester[32]
  • The Museum of the Manchesters was based at Ashton Town Hall but remains closed while the town hall is being redeveloped[33]
  • The Middlesex Regiment museum, formerly in Bruce Castle, closed in 1992 and was absorbed into the National Army Museum[34]
  • The Newcastle Discovery Museum includes the regimental museum of the Light Dragoons and the Northumberland Hussars[35]
  • The Museum of the Northamptonshire Regiment is based at Abington Park[36]
  • The Soldiers of Oxfordshire Museum (for the Oxfordshire and Buckinghamshire Light Infantry and the Queen's Own Oxfordshire Hussars) is based at Woodstock, Oxfordshire[37]
  • The Parachute Regiment and Airborne Forces Museum is based at Duxford, Cambridgeshire[38]
  • The Queen's & Princess of Wales's Royal Regiment Regimental Museum is based at Dover Castle[39]
  • The Queen's Own Hussars Museum is based at Lord Leycester Hospital in Warwick[40]
  • The Queen's Own Royal West Kent Regiment Museum is based at Maidstone Museum & Art Gallery in Maidstone[41]
  • The Queen's Royal Lancers and Nottinghamshire Yeomanry Museum is based at Thoresby Hall in Nottinghamshire[42]
  • The Rifles (Berkshire and Wiltshire) Museum is based in Salisbury[43]
  • The Royal Anglian Regiment Museum is based at Duxford in Cambridgeshire[44]
  • The REME Museum is based at MoD Lyneham[45]
  • The Royal Engineers Museum is based at Gillingham in Kent[46]
  • The Royal Green Jackets (Rifles) Museum is based at Peninsula Barracks in Winchester[47]
  • The Royal Hampshire Regiment Museum is based at Lower Barracks in Winchester[48]
  • The Royal Leicestershire Regiment Museum is part of Newarke Houses Museum in Leicester[49]
  • The Royal Lincolnshire Regiment and Lincolnshire Yeomanry collections are displayed in Lincoln's Museum of Lincolnshire Life[50]
  • The Royal Logistic Corps Museum is based at Princess Royal Barracks near Camberley in Surrey[51]
  • The Royal Marines Museum is in the course of relocating to Portsmouth Dockyard[52]
  • The Royal Norfolk Regimental Museum is based in Norwich Castle[53]
  • The Royal Regiment of Fusiliers Museum (Royal Warwickshire) is based at St John's House in Warwick[54]
  • The Royal Signals Museum is based at Blandford Camp in Dorset[55]
  • The Royal Sussex Regiment Museum and that of the Queen's Royal Irish Hussars is based at Eastbourne Redoubt in Sussex[56]
  • The Sherwood Foresters Museum is based in Nottingham Castle[57]
  • The Shropshire Regimental Museum is based at Shrewsbury Castle[58]
  • The Soldier's Story Gallery (for the Sherwood Foresters (Nottingham and Derbyshire) Regiment, the 9th/12th Royal Lancers and the Derbyshire Yeomanry) is based at Derby Museum and Art Gallery[59]
  • The Somerset Military Museum is based at Taunton Castle[60]
  • The Staffordshire Regiment Museum is based at Whittington Barracks near Lichfield[61]
  • The Suffolk Regiment Museum is based at Gibraltar Barracks in Bury St Edmunds[62]
  • The Surrey Infantry Museum was based at Clandon Park House, near Guildford until it was destroyed in a fire in April 2015[63]
  • The Tank Museum, the museum of the Royal Tank Regiment, is at Bovington Camp in Dorset[64]
  • The Worcester Soldier galleries (for the Worcestershire Regiment and the Queen's Own Worcestershire Hussars) is part of the Worcester City Art Gallery & Museum[65]
  • The York and Lancaster Regimental Museum is based at Clifton Park in Rotherham[66]
  • The York Army Museum (for the Royal Dragoon Guards, Prince of Wales's Own Regiment of Yorkshire and the Yorkshire Regiment) is based at the Tower Street drill hall in York[67]

Northern Ireland[edit]

  • The Royal Irish Fusiliers Museum is based in Armagh[68]
  • The Royal Ulster Rifles Museum is based in Belfast[69]
  • The Inniskillings Museum (for the Royal Inniskilling Fusiliers and the 5th Royal Inniskilling Dragoon Guards) is based at Enniskillen Castle[70]

Scotland[edit]

  • The Gordon Highlanders Museum is based in Aberdeen[71]
  • The Royal Scots Dragoon Guards Museum is based at Edinburgh Castle[72]
  • The Museum of the Royal Scots (The Royal Regiment) and the Royal Regiment of Scotland is based at Edinburgh Castle[73]
  • The Argyll and Sutherland Highlanders Regimental Museum is based at Stirling Castle[74]
  • The Highlanders' Museum (for the Queen's Own Highlanders (Seaforth and Camerons)) is based at Fort George[75]
  • The Black Watch Museum is based at Balhousie Castle in Perth[76]
  • The Royal Highland Fusilier Museum (for the Royal Scots Fusiliers and the Highland Light Infantry) is based at Sauchiehall Street in Glasgow[77]
  • The Cameronians Museum is part of the Low Parks Museum in Hamilton, South Lanarkshire[78]

Wales[edit]

  • The Royal Welch Fusiliers Museum is based at Caernarfon Castle[79]
  • The Regimental Museum of The Royal Welsh (for the South Wales Borderers and the Monmouthshire Regiment) is based at The Barracks, Brecon[80]
  • Firing Line: Cardiff Castle Museum of the Welsh Soldier (for the 1st The Queen's Dragoon Guards and the Royal Welsh) is based at Cardiff Castle[81]
  • The regimental museum of the Royal Monmouthshire Royal Engineers is based in Monmouth Castle[82]
